result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Anita Andrea Byrd.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Anita Andrea Byrd.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held.Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel requests an additional pre-trial conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Anita Andrea Byrd.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed on this case and requests bail review hearing date to address GPS monitoring conditions.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. No spin courts are available. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court authorized the defendant to attend a funeral, provided no one on the no contact list would be in attendance. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

22RM028405  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/31/2022 sa

Court ordered $1,500.00 CASH with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000.00 CASH.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd in court with attorney Robert J Hampton appearing as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court ordered $1,500.00 CASH with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000.00 CASH.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Case adjourned to Branch 35.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAF, QR (DOB 3/4/74), and NNJ (DOB 1/19/01).  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Anita Andrea Byrd in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anita Andrea Byrd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
